items.content_html:
This PR converts https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Media to Markdown.

Preparation PR: #9809.

Conversion report summary:

All unhandled elements

  • tr (676)
  • th[scope="row"] (628)
  • table.standard-table (103)
  • td (77)
  • th[scope="col"] (60)
  • td[style="vertical-align: top;"] (47)
  • th[rowSpan="2"][scope="row"][style="vertical-align: bottom;"] (16)
  • th[colSpan="4"][scope="col"][style="text-align: center;"] (15)
  • td[style="vertical-align: top; border-right: 2px solid #d4dde4;"] (10)
  • th[scope="row"][style="vertical-align: top;"] (7)
  • th[rowSpan="2"][scope="row"] (4)
  • th[scope="col"][style="vertical-align: bottom;"] (4)
  • table.standard-table[style="max-width: 42rem;"] (4)
  • td[rowSpan="2"][style="vertical-align: top;"] (3)
  • th[scope="col"][style="width: 216px;"] (3)
  • table.standard-table[style="margin-left: 4em; max-width: 30em;"] (2)
  • th[scope="col"][style="vertical-align: bottom; border-right: 2px solid #d4dde4;"] (2)
  • th[colSpan="3"][scope="col"][style="text-align: center; border-right: 2px solid #d4dde4;"] (1)
  • th[colSpan="3"][scope="col"][style="text-align: center;"] (1)
  • th[scope="row"][style="vertical-align: bottom;"] (1)
  • th[rowSpan="2"][scope="row"][style="vertical-align: top;"] (1)
  • th[colSpan="3"][style="font: italic 0.9em Arial, x-locale-body, sans-serif; vertical-align: middle;"] (1)
  • table.standard-table[style="max-width: 46em;"] (1)

Full conversion report: https://gist.github.com/wbamberg/fdf49a295a131dee7fa70aa16f6d9a2d

...these pages contain a lot of rather complicated tables, which are not getting converted. Apart form tables there are zero unconverted elements.

Apart from the usual randomness, the main changes here are:

  • removing elements like <a id="AAC"></a>, that are used to provide link targets, and updating any links that use those targets to use heading IDs instead.
  • removing elements like <a name="aac-foot-1">[1]</a>, that are used to provide targets for footnotes linked from the tables, and doing something else with the footnote (usually just copying it into the table).

After this PR there will be lots of unconverted tables, but nothing else.

There is good content in this bit of the docs, but I think it would be much more approachable if it were split up into more pages.
items.title: [Markdown] Convert Web/Media to Markdown - DO NOT SQUASH MERGE

items.content_html:
This PR converts https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide to Markdown.

Preparation PR: #9686.

Conversion report summary:

All unhandled elements

  • tr (14)
  • th[scope="row"] (10)
  • td[rowSpan="3"] (6)
  • table.standard-table (3)
  • td[rowSpan="5"] (3)
  • td[rowSpan="2"] (2)
  • th[rowSpan="2"][scope="row"] (1)

Full conversion report: https://gist.github.com/wbamberg/74041ada59777f272937dfaaf90bf54a.

The only unconverted elements are three tables:

  • one in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/HTML/Constraint_validation
  • two in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/Unicode_Bidrectional_Text_Algorithm (I just realised the slug for this page is wrong)

None of these should be convertible.
items.title: [Markdown][Web/Guide] Convert Web/Guide to Markdown - DO NOT SQUASH MERGE

items.content_html:
Summary

Inserts the preposition of in between the sample and the specification
Current: the sample the specification
My suggestion: the sample in the specification

Motivation

I believe that there is a missing of in preposition that links the part sample to the whole specification, at least it sounds better in my head with it.

Question: should we take advantage of this and also link to the actual example code of the specification repository?
I can't find the example code linked in the spec page, so perhaps it's useful to provide a direct link to it as it also has more examples.
Code example: https://github.com/WICG/visual-viewport/blob/gh-pages/examples/fixed-to-viewport.html
Spec page: https://wicg.github.io/visual-viewport/

It would end up like this:

The code below is based on [the sample in the specification](https://github.com/WICG/visual-viewport/blob/gh-pages/examples/fixed-to-viewport.html), though it adds

Supporting details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Visual_Viewport_API#example

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Missing preposition `in` on Visual Viewport API

Summary

Add info about AND logical operator in truthy, as it is present in the falsy glossary definition

Motivation

Not only for consistency, as it is present in falsy, but also because it is a feature that is seen a lot, for example, in React conditional rendering

Supporting details

Motivation

Supporting details

items.content_html: This PR removes the documentation for the MediaKeySystemConfiguration dictionary. Correlates with its removal in BCD, see mdn/browser-compat-data#12840.
items.title: Remove MediaKeySystemConfiguration dictionary from MDN

items.content_html: This PR removes the MediaCapabilitiesInfo dictionary from MDN, folding the bits of remaining data into the two methods that use it. Correlates with its removal in BCD, see mdn/browser-compat-data#12836.
items.title: Remove MediaCapabilitesInfo dictionary from MDN

items.content_html: This PR removes the documentation for the RTCTrackEventInit dictionary and folds it into the RTCTrackEvent() constructor. Correlates with its removal in BCD, see mdn/browser-compat-data#12831.
items.title: Remove RTCTrackEventInit dictionary from MDN

items.content_html:
Summary

Spotted while reviewing the specification for system colors – all of the other colors are in sync between the spec and MDN, although the order is different. The description I added is inspired by that of ButtonFace and ButtonText.

Motivation

Documentation on MDN should match specifications.

Supporting details

  • CSS Color Module Level 4 – 6.2. System Colors.

I couldn’t find any existing issue relating to "ButtonBorder".
items.title: Add missing CSS Color Module Level 4 system color: ButtonBorder

items.content_html: This PR removes the documentation for the RTCOfferAnswerOptions, RTCOfferOptions, and RTCAnswerOptions dictionaries from MDN, folding their data into the two respective methods that use it. Correlates with its removal in BCD, see mdn/browser-compat-data#12819.
items.title: Remove RTCOfferAnswerOptions and RTC[Offer/Answer]Options from MDN

items.content_html: This PR removes the documentation for the PaymentItem dictionary, folding the data into the two methods that utilize it. Correlates with removal work in BCD, see mdn/browser-compat-data#12817.
items.title: Remove PaymentItem dictionary from MDN

items.content_html:
Summary

  • The Intl.DateTimeFormat() returns months starting from index 1(for Jan). So the example should be showing 3 , 03 for March
  • Fix example value of Intl.DateTimeFormat() with options : {month: "numeric" || "2-digit"} to match the flow of document explanation

Motivation

Open-Source Contribution

Supporting details

Related issues

  • Fixes #9636

items.title: Fix Intl.DateTimeFormat() month option incorrect return value

items.content_html:
Fixes #9732

This originally said the fill() was filling with random values, but what they mean is "an arbitrary value I chose".
This makes it clear that the array is populated with the specified value.
items.title: Array.fill() does not populate with random values
